content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 12 in the given graph is:

1->3->9

Because node 4 can't be reached directly from node 12, the path was constructed by changing the destination point to the previous point on the path. In this case, the original shortest path is:

4->9->13

which minus node 9 from the end is:

4->13

which becomes:

3->9->13

which is then changed to:

1->3->9

Note that this is the shortest path that exists in the graph. If there are other paths that exist in the graph, they may or may not be shorter.

The shortest path from node 4 to node 3 in the given graph is:

4->7->11

This is because node 4 can't be directly connected to node 3. To find the shortest path, we have to go through node 7, which is the next node in the path, and then to node 11. This path is the shortest path that exists in the graph. If there are other paths that exist in the graph, they may or may not be shorter.
